Minh Tran

I'm a second-year PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Chicago, advised by Diana Franklin. Previously, I graduated with a dual degree in Computer Science and Psychology from the University of Arizona. Before college, I spent my life in a gorgeous mountainous province in the Northwest region of Vietnam.

cv   scholar   linkedin   contact

About

People always ask if I’m from Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City when I tell them I’m from Vietnam. But neither of those big cities in which I grew up.

I’m from Lao Cai, a province squeezed right next to the Vietnam-China border. It is the homeland of 25 out of 54 ethnic groups in Vietnam, and there located Fansipan - the highest mountain in the Indochina.

Fun fact: I could literally walk to China in 20 minutes from our house.

Photos by Minh Tran

Foodie

I love food. One of the best part of my experience living in the U.S. is being able to expose many cuisines from all over the world.

My love language is food. I cook and enjoy sharing Viet taste to my loved ones. But I’m never patient enough to write down my recipes…

Photos by Minh Tran
